sn1.9:4.2: Standing to one side, that deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.9:5.1: “Someone who’s fond of conceit can’t be tamed,
sn1.9:5.2: and someone without convergence can’t be a sage.
sn1.9:5.3: Living negligent alone in the wilderness,
sn1.9:5.4: they can’t cross beyond the realm of Death.”
sn1.9:6.1: “Having given up conceit, well converged inside oneself,
sn1.9:6.2: with a healthy heart, everywhere released;
sn1.9:6.3: living diligent alone in the wilderness,
sn1.9:6.4: they cross beyond the realm of Death.”
